artist_script:
A 130% growth in listings in China last year is a huge number for Airbnb to highlight.
HostB: And they're really going all out with this Great Wall promotion, aren't they? I mean, spending the night on the actual wall itself?
HostA: Yeah, and it's not just, like, a sleeping bag situation. They're installing proper beds with high-quality linens because, you know, even with the plexiglass ceiling, it can get chilly up there at night.
HostB: Right, and then they get this multi-course Chinese banquet with traditional musicians. That sounds incredible.
HostA: And the whole cultural immersion aspect is so key here. They've got official historians to talk about the Wall's 2700 years of history, plus calligraphy and seal engraving lessons.
HostB: But the application process is interesting too—you have to write about breaking down cultural barriers and building new connections. It’s not just a random draw.
HostA: Exactly. And the deadline's August 12th, Beijing time. Winners get a night on the Wall between September 5th and 9th, plus flights and other accommodations.
HostB: It’s such a smart way to blend tourism, culture, and, uh, brand storytelling. Like, who wouldn’t want to brag about sleeping on the Great Wall?
HostA: For sure. And it’s only for four people, so the exclusivity is part of the appeal.
HostB: Plus, you know, all those guest arrivals—3.5 million in the past year in China—they’re clearly tapping into a massive market.
HostA: Absolutely. It’s more than just a contest; it’s a statement.
